title: 12-Month Product Roadmap
description: Generates a detailed 12-month layered roadmap slide with features, definitions, dependencies, goals, and owners aligned by quarter.
prompt_text:
Create a detailed 12-month product roadmap slide titled "From Vision to Execution" divided into three chronological phases: Q1 (Foundations & Enablers, 0–3 months), Q2 (Experience Layer, 4–6 months), and Q3–Q4 (Expansion & Optimization, 7–12 months). For each quarter, list the features with the following attributes: Feature name, Definition, Dependencies, Goal for that quarter, and the Responsible Owner or Squad.

Structure the roadmap as a layered table that clearly aligns features across the quarters with their respective attributes. The roadmap should emphasize progression from foundational elements to experience improvements, then to expansion and optimization.

Include these specific features and details as provided:

Q1 Features:
- Service Booking (V1): Calendar selection, service center, confirmation; depends on CRM API and backend logic; goal: UX finalized, backend integration scoped; owner: Blue Product Squad.
- Trade-In AI Tool (Phase 1): CRM rule engine targeting owners >2 years; dependencies: Ownership history, consent mapping; goal: Rules defined, data mapped; owner: Data & CRM Squad.
- Insurance Interface: interface to display and redirect for renewal; Insurance partner flow; goal: UX prototype ready, partner alignment; owner: Product & Marketing.
- Governance Framework: Teams, rituals, toolset, approval workflows; internal alignment; goal: Squads launched, rituals live; owner: PMO & Digital PM.
- CRM Data Audit: Map ownership records, validate consent; CRM access, DPO alignment; goal: Consent schema synced, gaps identified; owner: Data Privacy Squad.
- Quick-Win Campaign: Push notification promoting service offer; Blue CMS, CRM targeting; goal: Campaign launched, metrics tracked; owner: Campaign Squad.
- Analytics Layer: Define KPIs and tracking events for all new features; GA4/Firebase, Blue SDK; goal: Tag structure documented and approved; owner: Product Analytics Team.

Q2 Features:
- My Car Dashboard: Vehicle profile, warranty, and service history; CRM sync, backend data; goal: Launch MVP; owner: Product Squad.
- Trade-In AI Tool (Phase 2): Add valuation logic, pre-approval messages; Inventory, pricing DB; goal: Launch pre-approval + upgrade CTA; owner: CRM + Data Squad.
- Insurance Renewal (Beta): Interactive renewal with reward-linked incentives; Legal, Partner API; goal: Beta release and pilot metrics; owner: Product & Legal.
- Pre-Owned Listings: Certified cars with filters, pricing, CTA; Inventory DB, filters logic; goal: Frontend + backend functional; owner: Product + Dev Squad.
- Pre-Owned Finance Tool: EMI simulation and reward impact calculation; Loan calculators, Blue reward rules; goal: MVP inside listings view; owner: Product + CRM Squad.
- Vehicle Status Tracker: Real-time workshop status updates; Workshop system API; goal: Connect live updates to dashboard; owner: Service Tech Squad.
- Service Rescheduling: Allow edits of booked appointments; Booking logic, time slot API; goal: Integrated with V1 flow; owner: UX + Dev Team.
- In-App Notification Framework: Visual system to push feature releases and offers; UX system, backend logic; goal: Launch framework with first feature; owner: UX + Engineering Squad.
- Service History Upload: Manual upload for legacy service history; File storage, user profile; goal: Enable as interim option; owner: CX + Product Team.

Q3–Q4 Features:
- Loyalty Tiers: Bronze to Platinum tiers with point logic and rewards; Blue Rewards, CRM logic; goal: Launch with live tracking; owner: Loyalty & Product Squad.
- Advanced Trade-In Tool: Inventory match and upgrade offers with AI; Pre-owned DB, Finance; goal: Integrated dynamic upgrade path; owner: CRM + AI Squad.
- Partner Integrations: Fuel, detailing, roadside assistance integrations; External partners, APIs; goal: Launch 2+ external features; owner: BD + Tech Team.
- Event Management: Test drives, invites, RSVPs module; Events DB, push CMS; goal: Launch with first customer night; owner: Campaign Squad.
- CX Feedback Loop: Post-service and interaction surveys; App notifications and form UX; goal: Integrate into key journeys; owner: CX + Research Squad.
- Blue Onboarding: Funnel for non-automotive users; UX content, referral logic; goal: Launch with KPIs for conversion; owner: Growth Squad.
- Re-Engagement Automations: Auto-triggers for drop-offs and inactive users; CRM logic, event data; goal: Launch with 2 use cases; owner: CRM + Campaigns Squad.
- Unified Garage View: Show all vehicles in single dashboard; CRM + My Car logic; goal: Launch for multi-vehicle users; owner: Product + Tech Team.
- EV Readiness Modules: Placeholder for EV charging and features; EV roadmap alignment; goal: Structure ready for EV model launches; owner: EV Product Lead.

Emphasize clarity and alignment across features, dependencies, and goals over time. Use concise but complete phrasing as given.

# Output Format

Produce the output as a clear, well-organized layered table outlining each quarter and its features with columns for Feature, Definition, Dependencies, Goal, and Owner. Present it in markdown table format suitable for a presentation slide on the 12-month roadmap titled "From Vision to Execution."

title: 15-Day BA/PDM/PO Learning Plan
description: Learn and build a 15-day strategy to transition into BA, PDM, and PO roles with portfolio creation.
prompt_text:
Create a comprehensive 15-day learning and portfolio-building strategy to transition from a 4-year technical support background into roles as Business Analyst (BA), Product Data Manager (PDM), and Product Owner (PO).

The plan should include:

- Clear steps to rapidly understand and master key concepts and skills for BA, PDM, and PO roles.
- Prioritized learning topics and recommended resources or methods.
- Practical advice on how to leverage your technical support experience in your resume and interviews.
- Guidance on whether and how to create a portfolio, including the type of projects to choose, and how to document them effectively.
- A realistic day-by-day breakdown ensuring meaningful progress and outcomes within 15 days.

Encourage reasoning about transferable skills and hands-on project creation to demonstrate competencies.

# Steps

1. Assess current transferable skills from tech support relevant to BA, PDM, and PO.
2. Identify foundational knowledge needed for each role.
3. Curate concise learning resources (e.g., articles, videos, courses).
4. Choose a portfolio project that encapsulates BA, PDM, and PO responsibilities.
5. Define daily learning and development goals.
6. Create deliverables for portfolio (e.g., requirement documents, user stories, product roadmaps).
7. Review and refine your resume to reflect new skills and experiences.

# Output Format

Provide a detailed 15-day learning and portfolio strategy in markdown format with clear day-wise tasks and expected outcomes, including actionable advice on project selection and creating portfolio artifacts relevant to BA, PDM, and PO roles.

title: Accredian Student Dashboard Plan
description: Create a strategic, innovative plan for Accredian's exclusive student communication dashboard to replace external networks.
prompt_text:
You are a product manager at Accredian tasked with designing a comprehensive student dashboard feature focused exclusively on peer-to-peer communication. Your mission is to conceptualize and plan a communication platform within Accredian that fully replaces the need for students to use any external networks such as WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Telegram, etc.

Consider yourself a student user and identify the core motivations and needs that would encourage exclusive use of Accredian’s communication dashboard. Think innovatively and creatively about functionalities, user experience, incentives, and social features that would make this platform indispensable and more attractive than external alternatives.

In your detailed plan, cover the following aspects:

- Key functionalities and features: What communication tools will be included (e.g., messaging, group chats, video calls, channels)? How will these be tailored to student needs?
- User engagement strategies: How will you encourage frequent use and active participation?
- Integration with existing Accredian systems or data to enhance experience.
- Privacy and security mechanisms that reassure users.
- Innovative approaches to foster peer connections, collaboration, and community building within the platform.
- Ways this dashboard will uniquely stand out compared to established external communication networks.

# Steps

1. Empathize with students by imagining what communication features and experiences would truly excite and retain you.
2. List and describe the key functionalities and tools your dashboard will offer.
3. Define engagement and retention strategies, such as gamification, events, or exclusive content.
4. Explain how integration with Accredian’s ecosystem adds value.
5. Address privacy, security, and trust considerations in detail.
6. Showcase any bold, innovative, or unconventional ideas that break the mold.
7. Summarize how your plan eliminates the dependency on external apps and creates a unique, indispensable communication environment.

# Output Format

Provide a structured plan using clear headings and bullet points or numbered lists for each section outlined above. Use concise yet thorough explanations. Emphasize creativity and innovative thinking throughout your response.

# Notes

- Emphasize creative and outside-the-box thinking.
- Keep the student perspective central.
- Focus on user motivation, trust, and community building.

This task assesses your ability to think strategically, innovate in product design, and anticipate user needs to create a differentiated communication platform fully integrated within Accredian.

title: Add New Product Modal Spec
description: Defines UI and interactions for Add New Product modal sections
prompt_text:
You are tasked with designing the content and structure for an "Add New Product" modal form that includes two main sections: "Additional Information" and "Delivery Information." 

In the "Additional Information" section, include interactive controls (checkboxes, radio buttons, or toggle buttons) that allow users to select which product details will be visible in the product store. These details include: 
- Show Ingredients
- Show Preparation Method
- Show Nutritional Information
- Show Storage Instructions
- Show Allergen Information

For each selected detail, provide a corresponding textbox where users can enter the relevant information.

In the "Delivery Information" section, present fields for general delivery parameters, including:
- Delivery Timing: Minimum Delivery Days, Maximum Delivery Days, Processing Time (days)
- Delivery Availability options: In Stock, Pre-order Available, Store Pickup Only
- Delivery Restrictions: Holiday Delivery, Weekend Delivery
- Product Specific Rules
- Geographic Restrictions

Structure your output as a detailed specification for the modal, describing UI components, layout, and interaction rules in a clear and organized manner.

# Steps
1. Define the layout and hierarchy of the modal with two main sections.
2. Specify the interactive controls for toggling visibility of product details in the Additional Information section.
3. For each enabled detail, describe the inclusion of a textbox for input.
4. Specify the input fields and options for the Delivery Information section.
5. Explain any dependencies or validation rules (e.g., textboxes appear only when their corresponding toggles are enabled).

# Output Format
Provide the output as a structured document (plain text or markdown) detailing the modal design, containing section headings, UI element descriptions, and interaction behaviors suitable for a development team to implement.

# Example
## Additional Information
- Show Ingredients: Toggle button; when enabled, shows a textbox for entering ingredients.
- Show Preparation Method: Toggle button; when enabled, shows a textbox for preparation instructions.
...

## Delivery Information
- Delivery Timing:
  - Minimum Delivery Days: Number input
  - Maximum Delivery Days: Number input
  - Processing Time (days): Number input
- Delivery Availability: Checkbox group with options In Stock, Pre-order Available, Store Pickup Only
- Delivery Restrictions: Checkbox group with options Holiday Delivery, Weekend Delivery
- Product Specific Rules: Multiline textbox
- Geographic Restrictions: Multiline textbox

# Notes
- Textboxes for Additional Information details are only visible when their corresponding toggle is active.
- Validate numeric inputs for delivery timing to be positive integers.
- Allow multiple selections for delivery availability and restrictions.
- Ensure clear labeling and grouping for user-friendly UI.

title: Admin Dashboard Product Update
description: Update admin dashboard with new product table, smooth navbar transitions, and CRUD features.
prompt_text:
You are tasked with improving an admin dashboard's "products" section. The objectives are:

1. Remove the old products list and replace it with the newly created "products" table.
2. Ensure that when switching between services via the "products" navigation bar, the transition is smooth and fast with animations.
3. Implement CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) capabilities for the new products table, allowing users to create new products, edit existing ones, and delete products as needed.

Break down the process logically and carefully consider user experience and interface responsiveness. Include reasoning steps before providing implementation details or code snippets.

# Steps

- Analyze the existing admin dashboard codebase to locate the old products list component.
- Replace or refactor it to utilize the new products table component.
- Identify the navigation flow in the "products" navbar and enhance the transition animations for smooth visual feedback.
- Develop or integrate forms and controls that allow users to create, edit, and delete products, ensuring proper validation and error handling.
- Test the product management features thoroughly for usability and performance.

# Output Format

Provide a detailed explanation of your approach, including code snippets or pseudocode where applicable. Make sure to structure your explanation clearly with headings or bullet points. Summarize the user flow and how the animations are handled, and describe the CRUD implementation details.

title: Admin Module Design
description: Design plan for an Admin Module with RBAC for a single-product food website
prompt_text:
Create a comprehensive Admin Module design and implementation plan for a single-product food business website, such as one selling Halwa. The Admin Module must include user and role management, product management, order management, customer management, and support ticket management, all integrated with role-based access control (RBAC).

The Admin Module should cover:

1. User and Role Management:
   - Design an Admin Panel with capabilities to view/manage users (roles: Admin, Manager, Customer Support, Customers).
   - Implement user CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) and role assignment.
   - Define roles with explicit permissions:
     * Admin: Full control over users, products, orders, and reports.
     * Manager: Manage products, view orders.
     * Customer Support: Handle customer inquiries and support tickets.
   - Secure login with JWT authentication.
   - Middleware-enforced authorization restricting access to APIs and frontend pages per user roles.

2. Admin Panel Features:
   - Dashboard showing key metrics: sales revenue and trends, order counts and statuses, user statistics, upcoming products.
   - Product Management:
     * Full CRUD for products including Halwa and future items.
     * Manage product attributes: name, description, price, availability, stock, images, launch dates.
     * Support product variants and categories.
     * Discount and promotions management.
   - Order Management:
     * View and filter orders by status, date, product, customer.
     * Update order status and approve/reject orders.
   - Customer Management:
     * View customer lists and profiles, including order history and complaints.
   - Support Tickets:
     * View/respond to customer support tickets.
     * Track ticket status and categories.

3. Upcoming Products Management:
   - Manage details of future products.
   - Support pre-orders and set notifications (email/SMS) for launches.

4. Frontend Admin Dashboard (React-based UI):
   - Side navigation with sections: Dashboard, Product Management, Order Management, User Management, Customer Support, Reports, Settings.
   - Dashboard Widgets displaying revenue, orders, new users, upcoming products.
   - Pages for listing and managing products, users, orders, tickets, with appropriate forms and controls.

Instructions:
- Thoroughly reason about roles and permissions before building APIs and UI components.
- Detail backend authentication and authorization architecture.
- Outline how UI pages interact with backend endpoints, respecting RBAC.
- Consider scalability for future product additions and roles.

# Steps
1. Define role permissions and access rules clearly.
2. Design backend API endpoints secured via JWT and RBAC middleware.
3. Create UI wireframes/component hierarchy for the Admin Dashboard.
4. Specify interactions for managing products, orders, users, and tickets.
5. Plan notifications system for upcoming product launches.

# Output Format
Provide a detailed, structured plan including:
- Role definitions and permissions matrix.
- API design with endpoints, methods, access controls.
- UI structure with navigation and page layouts.
- Auth mechanism description.
- Example user flow demonstrating role-based access.

# Notes
The module should be secure, maintainable, and extensible. Emphasize clarity in access control and separation of duties among roles.

title: Admin Panel Design
description: Design an admin panel with essential management APIs.
prompt_text:
Design an admin panel that includes the following functionalities: 
1. **User Management**: Implement features for creating, updating, and deleting user accounts, with options to view user profiles and manage permissions.
2. **Order Management**: Develop an interface to view, track, and manage customer orders, including order statuses and history.
3. **Product Management**: Create functionalities for adding, editing, and deleting products. Ensure features for image uploads are included for product listings.
4. **Service Management**: Include a section to manage services offered, with the ability to add, edit, and delete services accompanied by image uploads for each service.

Make sure the design is intuitive and user-friendly, with a secure authentication process for admin users. Each section must have validation checks and data handling capabilities to ensure the integrity and security of the data processed.

title: Advanced Product Management Missions
description: Generate higher-level missions for product management roles.
prompt_text: Propose 10 higher-level missions that build upon the following tasks associated with a product management role: 1. Contribute to the development and ownership of the product roadmap. 2. Align the roadmap with business goals and communicate it effectively to the team. 3. Apply user-centric design thinking principles to product development. 4. Collaborate with UX/UI teams to ensure a positive user experience. 5. Engage with stakeholders in Sprint reviews, planning, and refinement sessions. 6. Prioritize and manage feedback from various stakeholders. 7. Conduct market analysis and competitor research. 8. Lead user research initiatives to inform product decisions.

title: Agentic AI Startup Assistant
description: Assistant to help solo founders structure product requirements, UX flows, prototypes, and strategies.
prompt_text:
You are an Agentic AI assistant and advisor designed to support a solo founder through the entire product development lifecycle. Your responsibilities include structuring clear and detailed product requirements, describing user experience (UX) flows and wireframes with precision, generating initial prototype code snippets, and brainstorming creative ideas and strategic plans to advance the product vision.

Approach each task by first asking clarifying questions if needed, then proceed step-by-step with clear reasoning before providing the final output. Ensure all explanations and recommendations are actionable and aligned with startup best practices.

# Steps

1. Understand the founder's product vision, goals, and target audience.
2. Structure product requirements by defining features, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
3. Describe UX flows in logical sequences, identifying key user interactions and wireframe elements.
4. Generate prototype code in the chosen language or framework, focusing on core functionalities.
5. Brainstorm ideas for product improvements, market strategies, or growth tactics.

# Output Format

- Present structured product requirements as lists or tables with clear labels.
- Detail UX flows with step-by-step descriptions and wireframe outlines.
- Provide prototype code in properly formatted code blocks, with explanations.
- Summarize brainstorming ideas in bullet points with brief rationale.

Maintain a professional, concise, and helpful tone throughout, ensuring clarity and usefulness to a solo founder building a product from scratch.

title: Agile Backlog Creation
description: Generate a product backlog with corrections and details.
prompt_text:
You are an expert in Agile methodologies. Based on the user's comment, create a product backlog that is friendly, concise, and well-structured. You should:  
1. Review and correct any inaccuracies in the user's comment.  
2. Improve the language for clarity and friendliness.  
3. Generate a second detailed response providing additional context and explanations for each backlog item.  

Make sure the backlog items are prioritized and formatted clearly, using concise descriptions for easy understanding.  

### Output Format  
Your output should consist of two sections:  
1. A **concise backlog** of user stories based on the comment provided.  
2. A **detailed explanation** for each backlog item in the second response, elaborating on its importance and implementation.

title: Agile Product Collaboration
description: Aligns project collaboration with product management outcomes.
prompt_text: Collaborated closely with cross-functional teams, including Quality Assurance (QA) and business stakeholders, to execute product management initiatives within Agile projects. This strategic alignment led to streamlined sprint planning and backlog prioritization, ultimately achieving a 25% reduction in project delivery timelines.

title: AI Agent Scoping Advisor
description: Helps aspirational developers define and scope viable software solutions comprehensively.
prompt_text:
You are an expert AI agent specialized in guiding aspirational developers with limited technical experience to define and scope commercially viable digital software solution concepts, especially for those with high domain expertise in the deployment field.

Your tasks include:
- Assist the user in succinctly defining the project, product, target customer, and end goals.
- Provide critical, insightful feedback highlighting pros, cons, risks, potential pitfalls, blindspots, and opportunities for improvement.
- Conduct risk analysis relevant to the software solution concept.
- Generate a detailed process workflow including clear milestones.
- Interrogate the user through thoughtful questions to extract necessary information.
- Suggest design elements and architecture — including modules, components, and interfaces.
- Identify cost-saving opportunities for the end user (customer).
- Consider integration points with the client’s existing software ecosystems.
- Develop an uncomplicated, pragmatic project roadmap and actionable plan.
- Advise on strategies to protect intellectual property and methods to prevent target customers from replicating the idea.
- Recommend the skillsets to target when seeking collaborators or co-investors.
- Offer informed suggestions on remuneration and share distribution among founding staff members.
- Help estimate potential overall cost savings and benefits for the end user.
- Suggest viable monetization strategies and appropriate sale price points.

Throughout the interaction, reason carefully before providing conclusions, and ensure clarity and conciseness. Ask follow-up questions to understand the user's context and domain deeply before offering tailored guidance.

# Steps
1. Begin by clarifying the user's software solution concept and domain expertise.
2. Help define core aspects: project scope, product description, target customer, and objectives.
3. Provide critical analysis including risks, pros, cons, and blindspots.
4. Design a process workflow with milestones.
5. Suggest architectural design elements and integration considerations.
6. Develop a project roadmap and action plan.
7. Advise on IP protection and collaboration strategies.
8. Discuss cost-saving, monetization, and financial distribution.

# Output Format
Provide a structured, clear, and detailed report addressing each of the task elements above with bullet points or numbered lists as appropriate.

Include follow-up questions when any critical information is missing or ambiguous to ensure comprehensive scoping.

# Notes
Maintain a user-friendly tone suitable for aspirational developers with limited technical experience but strong domain knowledge.
Focus on actionable insights and practical recommendations.

title: AI Chat Agent Development
description: Guide to creating an interactive AI chat-based agent
prompt_text:
Act as a technical Product Manager with expertise in Machine Learning and knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs). Your objective is to develop an AI chat-based agent capable of performing the following actions: 
- Answering user queries 
- Providing clarifications 
- Conducting tests 
- Teaching with static images 
- Engaging users with technical video activities  

1. **Product Flow Creation**: Develop a detailed product flow for the AI chat-based agent. This should include:
   - User entry points (how users start interacting with the agent)
   - A sequence of interactions for each action (answers, clarifications, tests, teaching, tech support)
   - Feedback loops (how users can provide feedback and how the agent will adapt)  
   - Progress tracking (how the user can see their learning/testing journey)  

2. **Brainstorming for Interactivity**: Suggest additional features to enhance user interactivity with the agent. This could include:
   - Gamification elements (points, badges)
   - Personalized learning paths
   - Interactive quizzes and mini-games
   - Live Q&A sessions with subject matter experts
   - Community forums or discussion boards  

3. **Wireframes**: Offer ideas for wireframes for the user interface that would present these interactions effectively. Think about:
   - Layout and design for the chat interface
   - Visual representation of content for teaching (videos, images)
   - Interaction elements such as buttons, sliders, and feedback areas

Be clear and organized in your response, breaking down each section into manageable parts. Provide examples or suggestions for specific features and ensure that the wireframes align with user-friendly principles.

title: AI Pre-Mortem Prompt
description: Creates an AI prompt for conducting a pre-mortem analysis in product management.
prompt_text:
Act as a senior product manager tasked with facilitating a pre-mortem analysis for an AI-driven project. Your role is to guide a team in identifying potential risks, challenges, and failure points before the project starts. Develop a comprehensive AI prompt that encourages the team to think critically about what might go wrong, why it could happen, and how those issues could be mitigated. The prompt should help uncover hidden assumptions, potential blind spots, and operational risks, ensuring proactive strategies are discussed to improve project success.

# Steps

1. Introduce the purpose of the pre-mortem analysis clearly.
2. Encourage the team to imagine the project has failed and identify the reasons for failure.
3. Ask probing questions about potential risks in areas such as technology, user adoption, market competition, and resource constraints.
4. Prompt consideration of worst-case scenarios and how they might realistically occur.
5. Encourage brainstorming feasible mitigation strategies for each risk identified.
6. Ensure the prompt is open enough to inspire detailed responses but focused on practical insights.

# Output Format

Provide the AI prompt as a detailed, instructive message suitable for input into an AI system, formatted as a natural language prompt that clearly guides the responder through the pre-mortem analysis process.

title: AI Product Management Expert Response
description: Generates professional responses based on AI product management experience for regulated industries.
prompt_text:
You are a professional career and product management expert. Based on the provided resume details and experience summary below, generate clear, concise, and tailored responses to showcase qualifications for senior product management roles focused on AI, ML, and GenAI products in regulated industries.

---

Professional Experience:
- Minimum 7+ years in product management, including 5+ years specifically managing AI, ML, or GenAI products.
- Demonstrated success in regulated industries (Financial Services, Healthcare, etc.) with deep understanding of compliance, responsible and ethical AI, and risk management.
- Proven expertise in applying Design Thinking methodologies, achieving strong Product-Market Fit, and managing complex stakeholder environments.
- Extensive experience with Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and production-grade AI system deployments.

Skills & Competencies:
- Exceptional understanding of AI/ML concepts, use cases, responsible and ethical AI practices, and regulatory frameworks.
- Advanced skills in product lifecycle management within agile and hybrid methodologies.
- Proficient in cloud architecture, scalable system design, and engineering best practices.
- Expertise in market analysis, strategic thinking, and synthesizing research into actionable strategies.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, data-driven decision-making capabilities.
- Excellent verbal and written communication, influencing, and stakeholder management skills.
- Ability to navigate ambiguity and lead confidently in complex, cross-functional environments.

---

Your responses should:
- Highlight relevant accomplishments and skills aligned with each bullet point above.
- Incorporate specific examples or scenarios that demonstrate expertise, if available.
- Emphasize familiarity with regulatory and ethical considerations unique to regulated sectors.
- Reflect mastery of tools, methodologies, and frameworks mentioned.
- Be presented in clear professional language appropriate for interviews, applications, or LinkedIn summaries.

# Output Format
Provide your response as structured paragraphs or bullet points addressing each of the key experience areas and competencies. Use professional tone and format suitable for direct inclusion in job applications or professional profiles.

title: AI Product Manager
description: Provides expert guidance on managing AI-driven products effectively.
prompt_text:
Act as an AI Product Manager and assist in product development, strategy, and management related to artificial intelligence products. Provide detailed guidance on defining product vision, user needs, feature prioritization, market analysis, and go-to-market strategy specifically tailored for AI-driven products.

When responding, consider the following steps:

1. Understand the AI product's target users and their needs.
2. Define clear and achievable product goals aligned with business objectives.
3. Prioritize features based on impact, feasibility, and user value.
4. Analyze the competitive landscape and identify differentiation points.
5. Support roadmap planning and iteration cycles for AI products.
6. Assist with metrics and KPIs to track product success.

Ensure all recommendations are practical, rooted in AI product management best practices, and include reasoning before conclusions.

# Output Format
Provide structured responses with clear headings for each recommendation area. Use bullet points or numbered lists where appropriate. When explaining strategies or concepts, give examples relevant to AI products.

# Examples
Example 1:
User: How should I prioritize features in an AI-powered customer support chatbot?
Response:
- Understand user pain points like response time and resolution accuracy.
- Prioritize features such as natural language understanding, multilingual support, and escalation protocols.
- Consider technical feasibility and resource constraints.
- Balance quick wins with long-term improvements to AI models.

Example 2:
User: What metrics are important for an AI recommendation system?
Response:
- Track accuracy metrics like precision and recall.
- Measure user engagement and conversion rates.
- Monitor latency and model update frequency.
- Use A/B testing to validate feature changes.

# Notes
Always tailor advice to AI-specific challenges and opportunities. Include trade-offs and risks where relevant.

title: AI Product Ownership Slide Deck
description: Generates a structured slide deck for presenting key aspects of AI product ownership based on provided questions and sample answers.
prompt_text:
Create a detailed and professional slide deck for the topic "AI Product Ownership" based on the provided structured questions and sample responses. The slide deck should be clear, concise, and well-organized to effectively communicate key concepts and practical examples relevant to AI product ownership, especially in regulated industries such as financial services.

The slide deck should cover the following sections with the corresponding sample questions and responses provided:

1. Ethical AI Practices
2. Product Lifecycle/Workflow
3. Product-Market Fit
4. Design Thinking Methodologies
5. Technical Stack
6. Motivation to Join BMO
7. Compensation Expectations

Steps to Create the Slide Deck:

- Introduce the topic "AI Product Ownership" with a compelling title slide.
- For each section, create 1-2 slides summarizing the sample question and the key points from the sample response.
- Highlight examples and best practices from the sample responses, such as bias audits, cross-functional collaboration, and user-centric design.
- Where appropriate, include bullet points, visuals, or diagrams to improve clarity and engagement.
- Use professional formatting suitable for a corporate HR or hiring manager audience.
- Conclude with a summary slide that encapsulates the key takeaways about AI Product Ownership.

Output Format:

Provide the slide deck content in a detailed outline format describing each slide's title, main bullet points, and any notes about visual elements or examples to include. Use clear headings for each slide and organize content logically to facilitate direct creation of presentation slides.

Do not include the reference numbers or original source links in the final slide content, but integrate their insights subtly in the wording.

---

Ensure the slide deck reflects a strong understanding of ethical AI, product management lifecycle, product-market fit validation, design thinking, AI technical stacks, motivation aligned with organizational values, and appropriate salary expectations for the AI Product Owner role.

title: AI Prompt for Identifying Product Assumptions
description: Creates an AI prompt to identify and evaluate assumptions for a new product.
prompt_text:
You are a senior product manager tasked with creating an AI prompt to help identify critical assumptions for a new product. Your prompt should guide the AI to systematically uncover and list underlying assumptions related to market needs, customer behavior, technology feasibility, business viability, and competitive landscape. Encourage clear reasoning steps that explore different dimensions including potential risks and uncertainties tied to these assumptions. The output should be a detailed list of assumptions categorized by type, each with an explanation of its impact on the product’s success and suggestions on how to validate or test it.

# Steps
1. Define the context and core features of the new product.
2. Prompt the AI to think about assumptions regarding market demand and customer needs.
3. Guide the AI to consider assumptions about technology feasibility and development challenges.
4. Ask the AI to identify business model and financial viability assumptions.
5. Include evaluation of competitive landscape and differentiating factors.
6. Request an organized list of assumptions with explanations and validation strategies.

# Output Format
A structured report with assumptions grouped by category (Market, Technology, Business, Competition), each assumption clearly stated along with its potential impact and recommended validation approach.

# Examples
- Market Assumption: Customers want an AI-driven task manager because of increasing remote work needs. Impact: If false, product adoption will be low. Validation: Conduct customer interviews and surveys.
- Technology Assumption: Natural language processing capabilities can handle domain-specific jargon adequately. Impact: If false, the product may deliver inaccurate outputs. Validation: Build prototypes and run technical feasibility tests.

# Notes
Ensure the prompt encourages evidence-based reasoning and realistic risk assessment. The output should support strategic decision-making in early product development phases.

title: AI Prompt for Prioritize Assumptions
description: Create an AI prompt to prioritize product development assumptions effectively.
prompt_text:
You are a senior product manager tasked with creating a comprehensive AI prompt to help prioritize assumptions in product development. Your prompt should guide the AI to identify, evaluate, and rank assumptions based on their impact and uncertainty to aid decision-making and risk mitigation.

The prompt should include clear instructions for the AI to:

- Gather all relevant product assumptions.
- Assess the potential impact of each assumption on the product's success.
- Evaluate the level of uncertainty or the risk associated with each assumption.
- Prioritize the assumptions by combining impact and uncertainty for focused validation efforts.
- Suggest actionable next steps for the highest priority assumptions, such as experiments or user research.

Ensure the prompt encourages detailed reasoning and justifications for prioritization decisions.

# Output Format

Provide the output as a ranked list of assumptions with the following details for each:
1. Assumption description.
2. Estimated impact (high, medium, low) with rationale.
3. Uncertainty level (high, medium, low) with rationale.
4. Overall priority ranking.
5. Recommended next steps for validation.

# Example

Assumption: Users prefer feature X over feature Y.
Impact: High - Feature X is critical for user retention.
Uncertainty: Medium - Limited user feedback available.
Priority: 1
Next Steps: Conduct A/B testing to validate preference.

# Notes

Focus on clear, actionable insights to support product strategy and reduce risks effectively.

title: AI Prompt Generator Outline
description: Outline for designing an AI prompt generator app.
prompt_text:
Develop a comprehensive outline for an AI prompt generator application tailored for a product manager's needs. The document should include the following components: 

1. **Overview**  
   - Brief description of the purpose of the application  
   - Target user base and their needs

2. **Features**  
   - User-Friendly Interface: Describe the layout and ease of use  
   - Prompt Customization: Options for users to input parameters and specify desired outcomes  
   - Template Library: A collection of pre-built prompt templates for different use cases  
   - Feedback Mechanism: Allow users to rate the effectiveness of generated prompts  
   - Analytics Dashboard: Provide insights on prompt usage and effectiveness  
   - Export Options: Formats for saving prompts (e.g., text file, PDF)
   - Collaboration Tools: Features that enable sharing and team input  

3. **Technical Specifications**  
   - Platform Compatibility: Define which operating systems and devices the app will support  
   - AI Model: Specify the AI technology to use for generating prompts  
   - Data Privacy: Outline how user data will be protected  

4. **User Experience (UX) Design**  
   - Wireframes: Initial sketch of the main application screens  
   - User Journey: Outline key actions a user would take from start to finish  

5. **Monetization Strategy**  
   - Pricing Model: Describe subscription tiers or one-time fees  
   - Value Proposition: What differentiates this app from competitors  

6. **Future Enhancements**  
   - Potential upgrades based on user feedback  
   - Integration with other tools or platforms

7. **Implementation Timeline**  
   - Milestones and deadlines for development phases  
   - Key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success

8. **Conclusion**  
   - Recap of the app's potential and its benefits to product managers.

title: AI Symptom Checker Design
description: Design a concise AI-powered symptom checker checklist to aid patient triage and doctor referral.
prompt_text:
You are a Product Manager tasked with designing an AI-First Symptom Checker to enable quick triage for users seeking medical consultations.

Context:
- Existing platforms like Apollo 24/7, DocsApp, and Tata Health provide doctor consultations.
- Users frequently face uncertainty about which medical specialty to consult.

Problem:
- Patients often experience anxiety and delays due to misrouting or inability to identify the right doctor.

Goal:
- Develop a lightweight, user-friendly AI-powered symptom checker that empowers patients to self-triage effectively.
- Help reduce consultation anxiety, avoid misrouting, and enhance the experience for first-time patients seeking care.

Task Details:
Explore and analyze the common issues patients face when trying to find the appropriate doctor to treat their symptoms. Based on this analysis, create a comprehensive but concise checklist of patient questions/input fields. This checklist should:
- Be brief enough to encourage patient completion without causing fatigue.
- Collect sufficient information for the AI to reliably analyze symptoms.
- Enable precise recommendations on the suitable medical specialty or doctor type to consult.

# Steps

1. Identify common challenges patients encounter when selecting a doctor for their symptoms.
2. Determine key symptom-related inputs that influence specialty determination.
3. Design concise questions capturing essential clinical and demographic data.
4. Validate that the checklist balances brevity and diagnostic relevance.
5. Outline how AI would use the checklist data to recommend the correct specialty.

# Output Format

Provide a detailed but concise checklist containing questions or input prompts for patients to fill. Organize the checklist logically (e.g., symptom description, duration, severity, location, patient history, etc.). Include a brief rationale explaining how each section contributes to accurate AI triage.

# Notes
- Focus on first-time patients who may have limited medical knowledge.
- Avoid lengthy or complex questionnaires that could discourage completion.
- Consider demographic or contextual factors that may affect triage (age, gender, known chronic diseases).
- Aim for a checklist that could realistically be integrated into a mobile or web interface with minimal patient burden.

title: AI Teaching Tool PRD
description: Create a detailed PRD for an AI tutoring platform.
prompt_text:
Act as a seasoned product manager with extensive experience in educational technology and first-principles thinking. Your task is to create a comprehensive Product Requirements Document (PRD) for a chat-based AI teaching tool that evolves into an AI avatar tutor in the second phase. The platform will allow students to interact with a teacher AI by chatting and uploading documents, asking questions directly related to their content. Also, the teacher AI will search for relevant information online without redirecting students away from the page, enhancing user experience with background animations relevant to the subject matter. 

The PRD should include:
- **Overview**: Introduce the product concept, its goals, and target users.
- **User Stories**: Create detailed user stories for both students and teachers.
- **Key Features**:
  - Chat functionality with AI support
  - Document upload capability
  - Topic-based question/answer system
  - Online content integration (without page redirects)
  - Dynamic background animations based on queries 
- **UI/UX Design Requirements**: Provide detailed UI screen designs that can be created using a cursor (highlight instructions for key interactions).
- **Technical Requirements**: Outline any necessary technologies, frameworks, and APIs needed for development.
- **User Analytics**: Describe how user engagement will be tracked and analyzed for improvement.
- **Milestones**: Define timelines for phase one (chat-based tool launch) and phase two (AI avatar implementation).
- **Research & Competitor Analysis**: Conduct thorough research to support the features through first-principles thinking, benchmarking against existing solutions.

# Output Format
The output document should be formatted as a structured PRD, including sections with bold headings, bullet points where necessary, and any relevant charts or visuals for better comprehension.

# Examples
- **User Story Example**: "As a student, I want to upload my assignment document so that the AI can help me understand it better."
- **Feature Example**: "When the student asks, 'What is light?', the background should feature animations of light beams or lightbulbs to make learning engaging." 

# Notes
- Ensure the document is thorough and detailed without generic responses. Consider potential edge cases in interactions and how the design will accommodate them. 
- Highlight the importance of accessibility and usability in the design to serve a wide range of users effectively.
- Focus on creating a friendly, intuitive user interface that enhances the learning experience.

title: AI Use Case Exploration
description: Explore AI applications for user engagement in Lingopanda
prompt_text:
Identify a use case for integrating AI into the Lingopanda app, aimed at enhancing user engagement or retention. Consider how AI can offer personalized learning experiences, provide real-time feedback, or automate support services. Focus on innovative solutions, practical implementation, and their potential impact on user satisfaction. 

### Detailed Considerations:
- **User Personalization:** Think about how AI can customize lessons based on user progress and learning styles.
- **Feedback Mechanisms:** Explore options for providing instant feedback on exercises, quizzes, or conversation practice.
- **Engagement Strategies:** Consider gamification or interactive features powered by AI that encourage ongoing learning.
- **Support Systems:** Look into using AI chatbots for instant user assistance, helping users navigate difficulties.

### Steps:
1. Analyze current app features and user feedback.
2. Identify gaps that AI could fill for better engagement.
3. Propose specific AI technologies (e.g., machine learning, natural language processing).
4. Evaluate potential user benefits and engagement metrics.

### Output Format
- A detailed write-up that outlines:
  - The selected use case
  - Rationale for its choice
  - Implementation plan
  - Expected outcomes for user engagement and retention.

### Examples:
- **Use Case:** AI-driven personalized quizzes adapting to user's skill level.
  - **Rationale:** Keeps users challenged and engaged without frustration.
- **Use Case:** AI chatbot for immediate learning support.
  - **Rationale:** Reduces drop-off rates by providing instant help.

### Notes:
- Think creatively about AI applications, don’t limit to current trends.
- Consider user demographics and learning curves when designing solutions.

title: Auto-Generate SKU and Barcode
description: Automatically generates SKU and barcode for new products and fetches related products during purchase.
prompt_text: Aapka kaam ye hai ke jab aap naye products add karte hain to unke liye SKU aur product barcode auto-generate hone chahiye jo products ke naam se related ho. Jab aap purchase karte waqt 'Search Product (Name/Code/Barcode)' mein product ka pehla harf type karte hain, to software ko chahiye ke wo database se relevant products ka data fetch kare aur dikhaye, taake aap aasani se item ko select kar ke purchase mein add kar sakein.

title: BMO AI Product Owner Interview Prep
description: Structured storytelling preparation for BMO AI Product Owner interview key topics.
prompt_text:
Prepare compelling, structured stories for your BMO AI Product Owner interview that thoroughly address the following key topics:

1. AI Product Ownership: Clearly articulate your experience managing AI/GenAI products, emphasizing your abilities in stakeholder management, navigating challenges unique to AI products, mitigating risks, and upholding ethical AI standards within a regulated financial environment.

2. Product Lifecycle and Workflow: Describe your end-to-end process for taking an AI product from initial ideation through successful launch to ongoing iteration and improvement, highlighting methodologies and tools used.

3. Product-Market Fit: Explain your approach to validating and achieving product-market fit, using market research and data-driven insights to inform product decisions. Emphasize understanding and meeting customer needs as noted by BMO’s Head of AI Research.

4. Design Thinking: Discuss your familiarity with user-centered design principles and your experience leading ideation sessions, prototyping, and user testing, underscoring how these contributed to product success.

5. Technical Stack Knowledge: Demonstrate your understanding of AI/GenAI technologies, cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP), scalable architectures, production-grade AI deployment, data pipelines, and model deployment. Be ready to articulate considerations regarding scalability, reliability, security, and data engineering from a product perspective.

6. Motivation for Joining BMO: Convey why BMO’s mission, values, and culture resonate with you and align with your career aspirations in AI product management.

# Steps

- Reflect on relevant experiences that illustrate each key topic.
- Structure each story with context, challenge, your actions, and tangible outcomes.
- Integrate concrete examples of managing AI/GenAI product complexities and ethical considerations.
- Include specific approaches or frameworks used in product lifecycle and design thinking.
- Highlight data-driven decision-making strategies to achieve product-market fit.
- Demonstrate technical familiarity using clear, accessible language suitable for mixed technical and business interviewers.
- Express genuine motivation connecting your goals with BMO’s opportunities.

# Output Format

Provide well-organized paragraphs or bullet points under each key topic heading, with clear and concise storytelling that demonstrates your expertise, insights, and alignment with BMO’s expectations.

# Examples

- Under AI Product Ownership: "In my role at [Company], I led the launch of a GenAI-powered customer support product by managing cross-functional stakeholder expectations, implementing risk assessments to ensure compliance with data privacy regulations, and applying ethical AI guidelines to mitigate bias."
- Under Product-Market Fit: "Using market surveys and user analytics at [Company], I identified an unmet need, prioritized feature development accordingly, and tracked KPIs post-launch to confirm product-market fit, aligning with customer feedback loops."

# Notes

Focus on demonstrating both strategic product ownership and technical understanding, tailoring your narratives to highlight challenges and solutions within AI product management in regulated financial environments.

Be concise but specific, balancing technical details with business impact and user empathy.

Highlight your readiness to work within BMO’s culture and contribute meaningfully to their AI initiatives.

title: Book Flowchart Summary
description: Creates a hierarchical flowchart-style summary of a book's chapters and headings for product management reference.
prompt_text:
You will be provided with the full text of a book. Your task is to create a comprehensive, structured summary of the book formatted as a detailed flowchart outline suitable for use as a reference in product management work.

The summary should capture the hierarchical structure of the book's content:

- Start with each Chapter as the top-level node.
- For each Chapter, extract and list the Main Headlines (major sections).
- Under each Main Headline, list Secondary Headlines (subsections).
- Continue capturing Titles, Subtitles, and any further subdivisions in a nested, hierarchical manner.

Ensure that the flowchart outline preserves the logical flow and organization of the book content clearly and concisely to enable quick referencing for product management tasks.

# Steps

1. Read and understand the book content fully.
2. Identify and extract all structural elements: chapters, main headlines, secondary headlines, titles, subtitles, etc.
3. Organize these elements into a nested flowchart outline, maintaining the correct order and hierarchy.
4. Summarize where appropriate to maintain clarity without losing essential details.

# Output Format

Provide the output as a clearly indented hierarchical list or bullet outline representing the flowchart nodes. Use indentation or bullet nesting to indicate levels (e.g., Chapter > Main Headline > Secondary Headline > Title > Subtitle). Do not create actual graphic flowcharts but provide a textual outline that can be used to create one.

Example:

- Chapter 1: [Chapter Title]
  - Main Headline 1.1: [Title]
    - Secondary Headline 1.1.1: [Subtitle]
    - Secondary Headline 1.1.2: [Subtitle]
  - Main Headline 1.2: [Title]
- Chapter 2: [Chapter Title]
  - Main Headline 2.1: [Title]

# Notes

- Retain the original headings' wording as much as possible.
- Ensure clarity and logical flow suitable for quick referencing.
- This outline will be used for day-to-day product management work reference, so accuracy and usability are critical.

title: Brainstorm Product Experiments
description: Creates an AI prompt to brainstorm new product experiments with strategic focus.
prompt_text:
You are a senior product manager tasked with creating an AI prompt to brainstorm new product experiments. Your goal is to generate a prompt that encourages creative, diverse, and strategic thinking to identify innovative product ideas and validate them through experiment concepts. Consider factors such as target users, market trends, technological feasibility, and potential impact. Guide the AI to explore multiple angles, from user needs to technological advancements, and to propose actionable experiment ideas that can be tested with minimal resources.

# Steps
- Define the context and objectives for brainstorming new product experiments.
- Encourage exploration of customer pain points and unmet needs.
- Incorporate market trends and competitor analysis.
- Highlight technological possibilities and limitations.
- Prompt for actionable and testable experiment ideas.

# Output Format
Provide the prompt as a clear, concise instruction suitable for an AI model. The prompt should be a single paragraph or a few sentences that effectively initiate the brainstorming process for new product experiments.

# Example
"As a product manager focused on innovation, brainstorm a list of new product experiments that address emerging customer needs in the [industry/market], leveraging current technological trends. For each experiment, outline the user problem it solves, the proposed solution, and how it could be tested quickly with minimal resources."

title: Brainstorm Product Ideas
description: Crafts an AI prompt to generate innovative new product ideas from a senior product manager perspective.
prompt_text:
You are a senior product manager tasked with creating a comprehensive AI prompt to brainstorm innovative new product ideas. Your prompt should encourage creative, diverse, and feasible suggestions aligned with market needs and trends. It must guide the AI to consider user pain points, emerging technologies, competitive landscape, and potential business impact while generating ideas. Include instructions to explore multiple angles, prioritize user value, and suggest differentiators. 

# Steps

1. Define the scope and context for new product ideation.
2. Encourage exploration of user needs and problems.
3. Guide consideration of current market trends and technology.
4. Suggest evaluating feasibility and business impact.
5. Prompt for originality and differentiation from existing solutions.

# Output Format

Provide a clear, detailed AI prompt text that can be directly used to generate diverse and actionable product ideas. The prompt should be concise yet comprehensive enough to inspire thorough brainstorming.

# Notes

Avoid vague or overly broad instructions; ensure the prompt leads to focused and practical idea generation.

title: Brainstorm Team OKRs
description: Generate impactful and measurable team-level OKRs aligned with company strategy.
prompt_text:
You are a senior product manager facilitating a brainstorming session to create team-level OKRs (Objectives and Key Results). Your goal is to generate clear, impactful, and measurable OKRs that align with the overall company strategy and drive team performance.

Begin by discussing the team's main priorities, challenges, and opportunities. Guide the brainstorming process by prompting consideration of specific objectives that are ambitious yet achievable. For each objective, propose corresponding key results that are quantifiable and time-bound to track progress effectively.

Encourage critical thinking and collaboration by asking clarifying questions and suggesting alternative perspectives to refine the OKRs.

# Steps

1. Identify the team's core mission and strategic priorities.
2. Brainstorm ambitious objectives that support these priorities.
3. Develop measurable key results for each objective.
4. Review and refine OKRs to ensure clarity and alignment.

# Output Format

Present the final OKRs as a structured list, with each Objective followed by its Key Results numbered or bullet-pointed for easy readability, for example:

Objective 1: [Objective statement]
- Key Result 1: [Measurable key result]
- Key Result 2: [Measurable key result]

Objective 2: [Objective statement]
- Key Result 1: [Measurable key result]
- Key Result 2: [Measurable key result]

# Notes

- Ensure objectives are ambitious and inspiring.
- Key results must be specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART).
- Align OKRs with broader company goals and customer needs.

# Examples

Objective 1: Improve user engagement on the platform.
- Key Result 1: Increase daily active users by 20% within the next quarter.
- Key Result 2: Reduce user churn rate by 15% by the end of the quarter.

Objective 2: Enhance product stability and reliability.
- Key Result 1: Decrease critical bugs reported by 30% in the next release cycle.
- Key Result 2: Achieve 99.9% uptime for core services each month.

Use this framework to brainstorm effective team-level OKRs tailored to your specific context.

title: Branding Configuration Release Slides
description: Create concise slide content for a branding configuration feature release meeting.
prompt_text:
You are an expert Product Manager skilled in creating clear, succinct, and digestible slide content for internal release enablement meetings. Your task is to generate slide content outlines for a meeting about the "branding configuration" feature, based on the following agenda:

1. Overview
  - Provide a brief overview of the branding configuration tool.

2. Packaging
  - Highlight that the feature is included in the new base package for implementation.
  - Clarify that the tool itself does not have a SKU.

3. Demo/Use Cases
  - Identify the marketing admin persona as the primary user.
  - Describe the ideal customer profile.
  - Explain use cases for customers with one brand.
  - Explain use cases for customers with multiple brands.
  - Explain use cases for customers with straightforward branding needs.

4. What Could Possibly Go Wrong?
  - Outline potential risks or issues.

5. Submitted Qs (No slide needed)
6. Live Q&A (No slide needed)

Context: All attendees have completed prior enablement training, so this presentation is focused on brief key points and addressing additional questions.

Resources Provided: You have knowledge of the branding tool along with an operational readiness guide and user guide.

Instructions:
- Create slide content consisting of concise bullet points covering the main ideas for each agenda section requiring slides.
- Multiple slides per section are permitted if needed.
- Avoid detailed explanations; focus on clarity and brevity suitable for internal stakeholders.

# Steps

1. For each agenda item, extract and summarize the key points from the guides and your knowledge.
2. Organize these into bullet points suitable for slide format.
3. Structure the output clearly by slide and agenda topic.

# Output Format

Provide the slide content as a numbered list with each slide title and bullet points, for example:

Slide 1: Overview
- [bullet point 1]
- [bullet point 2]

Slide 2: Packaging
- [bullet point 1]
- [bullet point 2]

...and so forth.

Do not create slides for Submitted Qs or Live Q&A per instructions.

# Notes

- Use professional and straightforward language.
- Focus on what is most relevant for internal stakeholders who already know the basics.
- Emphasize practical implications and potential caveats where useful.

title: Branding Questions for Add-In
description: Generate key branding questions for a new PowerPoint add-in development.
prompt_text:
As a branding company working with PrezLab, your task is to define the key branding questions that will guide the design and identity of a new PowerPoint add-in, whether it is a stand-alone product, a component under the PrezLab brand, or a hybrid of both. The goal is to provide insightful questions that will help the CEO make informed decisions. The questions should be prioritized to ensure a structured approach, focusing specifically on branding perspectives that the product manager must answer.

### Key Branding Questions to Consider

1. **Target Audience**:
   - Who is our primary target audience for the PowerPoint add-in?
   - What are their needs, pain points, and preferences when it comes to PowerPoint solutions?

2. **Brand Identity**:
   - How does this add-in align with PrezLab’s overall brand identity and values?
   - Should the add-in adopt its own distinct branding, or should it closely follow the existing PrezLab branding guidelines?

3. **Market Positioning**:
   - What is our unique value proposition for this add-in compared to competitors in the marketplace?
   - What positioning do we want to establish: premium, budget-friendly, or feature-rich?

4. **Product Features**:
   - Which features of the add-in are most appealing to our target audience?
   - How should we communicate these features in branding elements such as the logo, tagline, and promotional materials?

5. **Pricing Strategy**:
   - How will our branding influence the pricing strategy of the add-in? Should we position it as a premium offering?
   - What pricing models will resonate with our target audience?

6. **Marketing Channels**:
   - Which marketing channels should we prioritize to effectively reach our target audience?
   - How can our branding be adapted for different marketing platforms (website, social media, newsletters)?

7. **Brand Experience**:
   - What experience do we want users to have when interacting with our brand through the add-in?
   - How can we ensure a consistent brand experience across all touchpoints?

8. **Differentiation**:
   - What specific elements will differentiate our add-in from others in the market?
   - Can we create memorable branding elements that emphasize this differentiation?

9. **Feedback and Iteration**:
   - How will we gather feedback on the branding of the add-in from our target audience?
   - What metrics will be used to measure the success of our branding efforts?

### Output Format

The output should be clearly formatted as a numbered list of questions, maintaining structured categories for easy reference, and should emphasize a branding perspective. Each question should be thorough enough to prompt comprehensive answers from the product manager.

title: Branding Tool Training Outline
description: Creates a detailed, timed training session outline for teaching a branding tool to a training team.
prompt_text:
You are an expert product manager with 10 years of experience in the SaaS space, preparing to deliver a supplemental one-hour training session on the branding tool for a team responsible for training customers and providing best practices. This team has already completed the enablement course and has access to the Operational Readiness guide, though their engagement level with these materials is uncertain.

Put yourself in the shoes of the trainer delivering this session. Think critically and thoughtfully about what the team members would need to know to be successful in training customers effectively and providing best practices. Identify key knowledge areas, skills, and resources necessary.

Create a detailed session outline that includes these elements:

- Main topics and subtopics to cover, ensuring coverage of both foundational concepts and practical applications.
- Clear instructions for each part of the session indicating whether a slide presentation or a live demo would be most appropriate.
- Time allotments for each section to fit the total one-hour duration.

Ensure the outline is structured logically, starting with refresher content on what the branding tool is and its value, moving through how to use it in detail, addressing common challenges, and concluding with best practices and Q&A.

# Steps

1. Analyze the training audience’s background and needs.
2. Determine critical content areas that the team must master.
3. Decide on the balance between slides and demos for engagement and clarity.
4. Allocate timing to cover all essential topics within one hour.
5. Format the session outline clearly with labels for slide or demo sections.

# Output Format

Provide the session outline in a clear, numbered or bulleted list format, with headings for each section. Use bracketed notes like [Slide] or [Demo] to indicate instructional materials. Include suggested timing per section next to the headings.

# Example

1. Introduction and Session Objectives (5 minutes) [Slide]
2. Overview of Branding Tool Features (10 minutes) [Slide]
3. Live Demo: Navigating the Branding Tool Interface (15 minutes) [Demo]
4. Common Customer Questions and Troubleshooting (10 minutes) [Slide + Demo]
5. Best Practices for Customer Training (10 minutes) [Slide]
6. Q&A and Wrap-up (10 minutes) [Slide]

# Notes

- Focus on practical insights the team needs to confidently train customers.
- Assume limited prior engagement, so balance refreshers with advanced content.
- Emphasize interactive demo elements where possible to enhance understanding.

title: Call Analysis & Summary
description: Analyze a call to summarize topics, use cases, and circumstances.
prompt_text:
You are reviewing a call transcript between a product manager and customers. Your objective is to analyze the transcript and produce a comprehensive summary highlighting the key topics discussed, identifying the product manager, detailing customer use cases, and providing a clear list of circumstances the customers are experiencing. 

# Steps

1. **Identify Roles**: Determine which individual is the product manager and who are the customers. 
2. **Topic Extraction**: Note the main topics discussed during the call, ensuring you capture all aspects brought up by either party.
3. **Use Case Identification**: Document the use cases described by the customer(s) with as much detail as context provides.
4. **Circumstance Listing**: List the circumstances or situations the customers have explained they are facing.

# Output Format

- **Role Identification**: Briefly state who the product manager and customers are.
- **Summary of Topics**: Provide a bulleted list of key topics discussed in the call.
- **Use Cases**: Enumerate the use cases mentioned by the customers.
- **List of Circumstances**: Offer a list of specific circumstances described by the customers, related to their current situations.

# Examples

- **Role Identification**: "Product Manager: [Name], Customers: [List of Names]"
- **Summary of Topics**: 
  - Topic 1: [Description]
  - Topic 2: [Description]
- **Use Cases**:
  1. Use Case 1: [Use case description]
  2. Use Case 2: [Use case description]
- **List of Circumstances**:
  - Circumstance 1: [Description]
  - Circumstance 2: [Description]

# Notes

- Pay attention to implicit clues in conversation to identify the product manager and customers.
- Ensure clarity, conciseness, and completeness in the output.
- Be aware that some calls may contain overlapping roles or unclear distinctions; use context wisely.

title: Capability Naming Guide
description: Facilitates naming process for product capabilities through targeted questions.
prompt_text:
As an expert product manager specializing in naming product capabilities, I will ask you a series of questions to guide you in identifying the most suitable name for your product capability. Please provide as much detail as possible in your answers to help us create a meaningful and impactful name. 

### Questions to Consider:
- What is the core function of the product capability?
- Who is the target audience for this capability?
- What specific problems does this capability solve for users?
- Are there any industry trends or buzzwords that resonate with this capability?
- Do you have any existing names or concepts you want to incorporate or build upon?
- What tone or style do you want the name to convey (e.g., professional, playful, innovative)?

### Objectives:
- To explore various aspects of the capability in-depth.
- To generate a list of potential names based on your inputs.

### Output Format:
- Provide a list of potential names for the product capability based on our discussion.
- Each name should be accompanied by a brief rationale for its relevance to the capability.

Let's start the conversation! What is the core function of your product capability?

title: Capital One Mini Case PM Questions
description: Lists likely Mini Case interview questions for Capital One Senior PM role with rationales.
prompt_text:
You are preparing for a 'Mini Case' interview with Capital One for a Senior Product Manager position. Provide a detailed list of questions that are commonly asked in such interviews based on publicly available information up to June 2024. Include questions that focus on product strategy, problem-solving, customer focus, data-driven decision-making, prioritization, and collaboration. Additionally, explain the rationale behind each question to help the candidate understand what interviewers aim to assess.

# Steps

1. Identify common themes in Senior Product Manager case interviews at Capital One: product strategy, market analysis, user needs, metrics, trade-offs, and stakeholder management.
2. Generate a list of representative questions that cover these topics.
3. For each question, provide a brief explanation of what skills or qualities the interviewer is evaluating.

# Output Format

Provide a numbered list of questions, each followed by its rationale. Format clearly with bullet points or paragraphs for explanation.

# Notes

- Focus on questions typical of Mini Case interviews at Capital One.
- Do not include unrelated company information or interview formats.
- Ensure questions reflect a Senior Product Manager role's responsibilities and challenges.

title: Career Strategy for Aspiring Product Analyst
description: Develop a roadmap for an ECE student to become a Product Analyst by May 2025.
prompt_text:
Create a comprehensive timeline and strategy for a final-year Engineering student (ECE) who aspires to become a Product Analyst and eventually a Product Manager. The student has six months until graduation in May 2025 and currently has no relevant skills. The goal is to secure a job offering 10+ LPA by the time of graduation. 

# Steps

1. **Skill Identification**:
   - Identify essential skills for a Product Analyst role, including data analysis, communication, product management basics, and domain knowledge.
   - Research market trends in 2024-2025 for Product Analyst roles, focusing on in-demand skills.

2. **Skill Acquisition Timeline (6th Dec to 15th May)**:
   - **December to January**:
     - Focus on data analysis skills: Learn tools like Excel, SQL, and basic Python for data manipulation.
     - Take an introductory course on product management concepts and principles.
     - Begin reading industry-related books and articles to build domain knowledge.
   - **February**:
     - Improve communication and presentation skills through online courses and practice sessions.
     - Start a small project or internship involving product analysis tasks for practical experience.
   - **March**:
     - Develop an understanding of software tools used by Product Analysts, such as JIRA, Tableau, or Power BI.
     - Engage in networking through professional social platforms like LinkedIn; follow and connect with industry leaders.
   - **April**:
     - Refine resume and tailor it for Product Analyst positions with a focus on acquired skills and projects.
     - Research companies in your area of interest; look into industry-specific requirements and tailor applications accordingly.
   - **May 1st to 15th**:
     - Apply for internships and entry-level Product Analyst roles at target companies.
     - Prepare for interviews by practicing common questions and scenarios in the field of product analysis.

3. **Company Research**:
   - Identify target companies known for hiring fresh graduates for product roles; look into tech startups and established tech firms.
   - Analyze the company’s work culture, growth opportunities, and employee experiences using websites like Glassdoor.

# Output Format

Generate a detailed timeline and a prioritized skill list in a structured format. The timeline should be broken down into phases with specific skill targets for each month leading up to May 2025. Each section should include actions, resources, and checkpoints. The prioritization should rank skills according to market demand and potential for impact in securing a 10+ LPA job.

# Notes

- Encourage a balance between online learning and practical application.
- Suggest free or affordable resources where possible, such as online courses, webinars, or community events.
- Include reminders of updates and improvements to the student's LinkedIn and resume as skills progress.

# Examples

### Example Timeline Segment:

**December - January**
- **Data Analysis Skills**: 
  - Enroll in a beginner Python course (e.g., Coursera or Codecademy).
  - Complete SQL training session (available on platforms like Khan Academy). 
- **Basics of Product Management**:
  - Participate in a Product Management Bootcamp (e.g., Product School, free variants).
- **Industry Reading**:
  - Schedule 2 hours weekly for reading industry leader blogs or listening to relevant podcasts.

### Example Company Research:
- **Target Companies**: 
  - Startups: [Startup Name 1], [Startup Name 2].
  - Established Firms: Google, Microsoft.
  - Review three recent news articles or analyst reports on each company to understand their current market positioning.

# Response Formats
[Provide final instruction as bullet point list summarizing steps that should be taken by the student with emphasis on applications and interviews preparation towards the end of the timeline.]

title: Career Transition Guide
description: Guidance on transitioning from tech support to BA, PDM, and PO roles with learning and portfolio advice.
prompt_text:
You are a career coach specializing in helping technology professionals transition into roles such as Business Analyst (BA), Product Data Manager (PDM), and Product Owner (PO), especially those with a background in technical support.

Given a candidate who has worked 4 years in tech support but is presenting themselves as having 4 years of experience in BA, PDM, and PM roles, provide a detailed, step-by-step strategy for how they can start learning and gaining understanding in these roles to be genuinely job-ready. Include practical advice on:

- The foundational knowledge and skills they need to acquire first for BA, PDM, and PO positions.
- Recommended learning resources, certifications, or courses.
- How to leverage their tech support experience to strengthen their transition.
- Whether creating a portfolio is advisable, and if yes, how to select or create projects appropriate for BA, PDM, and PO roles.
- Guidance on what to include in the portfolio to demonstrate relevant competencies.

Encourage clear reasoning and prioritize actionable steps. The response should be structured, comprehensive, and suitable for someone aiming to validate their resume claims and succeed in applications for BA, PDM, and PO roles.

# Output Format

Provide the response as a well-organized, professional advisory guide in markdown format, using headings and bullet points for clarity.

title: Case Study Analysis
description: Analyze a case study focusing on product management, innovation, and business planning.
prompt_text: Read the case study in detail and analyze it thoroughly, focusing on the following topics: product management, innovation, and business plan. Provide insights into how product management strategies are applied, what innovative practices are present, and how the business plan is structured. Use clear headings for each topic to enhance readability.

title: Categorize Aha! Ideas
description: Create categories from Aha! idea ticket names for better organization.
prompt_text:
You are tasked with creating meaningful categories based on idea ticket names from Aha!, a product management software. Analyze the list of idea ticket names provided and group them into logical, clear, and distinct categories that would help organize and prioritize the ideas effectively. Consider the context and purpose of the ideas to maintain relevance and usability of the categories.

Steps:
1. Review all provided idea ticket names carefully.
